cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles north of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then turning northwest between Cuba and the Bahamas toward South Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge watches extend from the east-central Florida coast northward to Sebastian Inlet and from Bonita Beach northward to Anna Maria Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings cover the Florida Keys, south Florida coast, the Turks and Caicos, southeastern-central-northwestern Bahamas, and parts of north-central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Turks and Caicos, Bahamas, northern Cuba coastline and the entire Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Irma brought tropical-storm-force winds with occasional hurricane-force gusts as the northern eyewall skirted Puerto Rico on 6 Sep; conditions have since improved but residual gusty squalls remain.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat expected for San Juan because the cyclone’s center is now well west of Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 2–4 inches of rain possible on saturated ground, producing localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will persist along north-facing beaches for several days.
